column5: Forgot to mention I was out in Waterford a couple weeks ago and the CO nailed a few people for using more that one rod at a time. The guy next to me said he wanted to nail them 'cuz they were using multiple rods. He went from one side of the street to the other and was a good hour dealing with them all. Once he was done with them he left. He didn't even come up to us. Too bad though 'cuz I was gonna ask what fine he gave 'em. I don't think he confiscated their equipment but I'm not sure on that one. We were a bit up the road. Good to see they do get out there. That's the first time I've seen 'em.
$30 + $50 for each rod, makes it $130 for two rods. should be more i think..
That's not enough if you ask me....some people may take that risk at that price unfortunately
I wish there was a CO out at the GBay trib I fished tonight..  Who the hell fishes in a 4ft deep pool with a monster five of diamonds?  Brutal snagfest..
But trout like them big Len Thompson spoons... it's my go to lure ! (downrigging!)
So you troll with a downrigger in 4' of water?  How far back from the ball do you run it?   sorry...but that made me laugh
Wayne, I'm sure the trout love it!!!  These chinnies weren't to fond of it.
You mean there's still salmon left out there??
I saw a tonne of fish this evening... I guess there were sick and tired of waiting for the rain and decided to come up river anyhow.
